author: demiurgos_23
content: What is the proposed way to handle the collision of the opcode `RETF` from EIP-4750 and `PUSH0` from EIP-3855 ? both suggested to have the value `0x5F` ?

author: chfast
content:
In our implementation:
CALLF 0xfb cost 8
RETF 0xfc cost 8

author: demiurgos_23
content: okey, will there be a new suggested value for those opcodes ?

author: chfast
content: I'm not sure if we picked anything new (cc <@425279588009246720>), but you can suggest some.

author: chfast
content: <@543900561460822016> just dropped the change to EIP-4750 so feel welcomed to comment there. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5888

author: gcolvin
content:
> CALLF 0xfb cost 8
> RETF 0xfc cost 8
That's the same cost as a dynamic jump.  But it's static, with no need to push/pop the 256-bit destination and convert it to a native value and check the jumpdest.  The immediate data and native return stack should be more efficient, so why not substantially less gas?

author: chfast
content: These are arbitrary values to have working implementations. The discussion about gas costs for `RJUMP`, `RJUMPI`, `CALLF`, `RETF` is open.

author: _shemnon

author: lightclient
content: assuming the "full" eof should we just go ahead and deprecate `CALLCODE`, `JUMP`, `JUMPI`, `JUMPDEST` and `SELFDESTRUCT`?

author: chfast
content:
Yes. Definitely on devnet. We were debating this internally. We can do this as:
- Undefine `CALLCODE` and `SELFDESTRUCT` in EIP-3670: Code validation.
- Undefine `JUMP`, `JUMPI`, `JUMPDEST` in EIP-4750: EOF Functions.
OR
- Create new EIP which undefines all above.

author: _shemnon
content: The risk of a new EIP is the instruction removal become viewed as severable instead of integral.

author: lightclient
content: would much rather update the existing eips

author: lightclient
content: just post this with each update:

author: chfast
content: One security consideration that kinda came up today: a create transaction with invalid EOF initcode is considered invalid (cannot be included in a block). This mean a tx pool must perform a EOF validation and potentially discard such transaction. Attack vector?

author: lightclient
content: I don't think so, probably cheaper to validate EOF than do state look up. But might be interesting to only allow EOF initcode via `CREATE` and `CREATE2`

author: chfast
content: Nah, we at least want to be able to imagine EOF only system.

author: chfast
content: Propagating invalid transactions is considered impolite?

author: chfast
content: I will add this to "Security Considerations" anyway. Finally some use for this section.

author: lightclient
content: i see, good point
